column2: A 50-year-old man presents for a follow-up examination. He has a 2-month history of headache and shortness of breath with exertion. He also has hypertension that has been treated with hydrochlorothiazide for 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mm Hg. Which of the following tests is most likely to be seen on ophthalmoscopic examination of this patient?
column3: A 50-year-old man comes to the clinic for a follow-up examination. He has had headache and shortness of breath with exertion for 2 months. He also has hypertension and has been treated with hydrochlorothiazide for 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mm Hg. Ophthalmoscopic examination is likely to reveal which of the following in this patient?
column4: A 50-year-old man comes to the doctor's office for a follow-up examination. She has a two-month history of headaches and shortness of breath on exertion. He also has hypertension, which he has been treating with hydrochlorothiazide for the past 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mm Hg. Ophthalmoscopy is most likely to demonstrate which of the following in this patient?
column5: A 50-year-old man comes to the practice for a follow-up examination. He has been complaining of headaches and shortness of breath on exertion for 2 months. He also suffers from high blood pressure, which has been treated with hydrochlorothiazide for 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mm Hg. Which of the following findings is most likely to be expected in this patient during an ophthalmoscopic examination?
column6: A 50-year-old man comes to the office for a follow-up examination. He has a 2-month history of headaches and shortness of breath on exertion. He has also had hypertension treated with hydrochlorothiazide for the past 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mm Hg. Which of the following is the most likely ophthalmoscopic finding in this patient?
column7: A 50-year-old man comes to the clinic for a follow-up examination. He has had headaches and dyspnea on exertion for the past 2 months. He has also been treated for hypertension with hydrochlorothiazide for the past 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mmHg. Which of the following is most likely to be the cause of this patient's ophthalmologic examination?
column8: A 50-year-old man is seen for follow-up examination. He has had headaches and shortness of breath on exertion for the past 2 months. He has also been treated for hypertension with hydrochlorothiazide for the past 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mmHg. On ophthalmologic examination, which of the following is most likely to be the cause of this patient's ophthalmologic findings?
column9: A 50-year-old man comes to the office for a re-examination. He has had headaches and shortness of breath on exertion for 2 months. He also has hypertension treated with hydrochlorothiazide for the past 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mm Hg. Ophthalmoscopic examination of the patient is most likely to show which of the following?
column10: A 50-year-old man comes to the office for a follow-up examination. He has had headaches and shortness of breath on exertion for 2 months. He also has hypertension and has been treated with hydrochlorothiazide for 2 years. His blood pressure is 180/105 mm Hg. Ophthalmoscopic examination will likely reveal the following in this patient?
column11: A 50-year-old man comes to the office for a follow-up visit. He has a 2-month history of headache and shortness of breath with exertion. He also has hypertension that has been treated with hydrochlorothiazide for the past 2 years. Blood pressure is 180/105 mm Hg. Ophthalmoscopic examination is most likely to show which of the following in this patient?
